intro: Urostachys cubanus, commonly known as the Cuban star grass, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, pale yellow to green flowers. Urostachys cubanus is adapted to the warm, humid climate of its native region and is often found in coastal areas.
